intro: Brachystelma lineare, commonly known as the linear stone orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the Acanthaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its compact, succulent-like appearance with fleshy, linear leaves. It produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple, typically during the summer months. Brachystelma lineare is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well adapted to arid environments.
